name: Pragmatism at its Best
description:
So I know it's Super Early to start talking about what I believe is going to be one the best slow game Criminal Runners, but here's my idea for what I want to do with her.

So the core idea is that you fish for Keyhole, all the while earning lots of money. You then drop Keyhole and try and make your play. You should try and Keyhole 2 times at the least the turn you drop it. It should come as a surprise. If you can drop 2 agenda's in their Archives and then run on it you can bounce 2 unrezzed pieces of ice as well. Which is why you shouldn't be running anywhere but R&D and Archives. Also Account Siphons, and Unscheduled Maintenance is there to ensure that they don't have enough time or money to drop more then 1 piece of ice.

When you Score and bounce ICE you Kraken whatever is left on the server. And New Angeles City Hall so you can Account Syphon AND have Rachel Beckman out at the same time. Anyway what do you guys think?

name: Little girls prefer Dinosaurus...
description:
The main idea behind this deck is to make every run as cheap as possible while lowering the installation cost at maximum.

Strategy:

  1. Find magnus opus by searching through your deck with diesel /QT
  2. On the way make some money with freelance coding contract. You will then be able to tutor the program trashed with clone chip.
  3. Clone chip / smc allows you to search any program you might need during a run
  4. Retrieval run is there to install either magnus opus or battering ram cheaper
  5. With 3 leprechaun & the +1 MU of CT, I had never any MU issues
  6. The sentry breaker suite was originally designed as deus ex / sharpshooter / gingerbread. This allows you to have a cheap dedicated solution for any ice (except susanoo / guard / chimera). The faerie is a late inclusion allowing more flexibility
  7. The dinosaurus can either be left free for trashable breaker or you can assign battering ram / gingerbread or cyber-cipher on it depending on the corp deck
  8. If needed you can cycle your entire deck 2 times by using Larla.

Any feedback would be welcome.

name: BlackPlague
description:
This deck is Blackmail for Anarchs.

I've been playing Blackmail decks with CT in Shapers and with Rihanna in Crims, but I think this version is more solid due to the multi-access it can do with a single Blackmail. CT can give you more draw in a 40 card deck and Rihanna also provides some tutors like Express Delivery plus her abillity to look at possible targets, also with a 40 card deck.

Anarchs are a bit tricky. It's possible to spam Express Delivery or Quality Time but they got their own draw engine: Wyldslide. That's the first thing to hit the table. Then Aesop, then the combo pieces (NACH + Activist Support) and then you can trigger Blackmail runs.

To be full of wins, you'll need to install Grimoire and then trigger the 2nd part of the combo, Virus + Surge.

There are a lot of cards to have in your hands but it's the best you can make for a single Blackmail instead of random runs. Nerve Agent into Surge into Blackmail breaks a FastAdv deck that keeps their Agendas in hand. Also, Medium can exploit R&D.

Lots of fun. Combo decks FTW!

name: Orbital Response Teams
Femme Atman Retrieval
description:
The main idea is to use Femme to bypass ICE on rez, this way you can choose weather to gain the creds or not with your ability and it can be cheated into play from Test/Scavenge or Retrieval run.

Also Diesel/QT and freelance allow you to dump programs into your heap for retirval runs/clone chips/test runs.

If the corp decides to trash Femme'd ICE then you can scavenge them onto new ICE and when you start to Parasite ICE 2 they maybe less likely to trash their ICE so quick.

and finally Atman helps you get through later when you know what to expect plus a Nasir staple PW to make the most of your cash.

name: Cached Memories v0.3
description: Now with viruses!

name: Dec@Day.07 - Surcharges Apply
description:
Dec@Day - Every identity, one day and deck at a time. It's like NaNoWriMo for Netrunner! More info in my profile.

Weyland's core ID was a little...lackluster when it first came out, but boy have we gotten some sexy Operations released in the meanwhile. Restructure is a huge boost, Green Level Clearance replaces itself, and Desperado-on-an-Operation nets a credit just for putting it into play. Our burst economy should have no issue keeping our credit pool nice and thick, and once we score a Government Contracts, we have a mini-Melange ready to back us up should we ever need it.

For ICE, Ice Wall and Quandary are nice binaries for keeping the Runner from doing anything too crazy the first few turns, but we're really looking to get those Tollbooths, Eli 1.0s, and Hadrian's Wall online as soon as possible to make our centrals and solitary remote taxing. Taurus is our solution to any pesky hardware, and Will-o'-the-Wisp should bury their Fracter or Decoder long enough to open a scoring window.

Suggestions, critiques or comments? Feel free--the entire reason I'm doing this is to build my deckbuilding skills. Tomorrow kicks off the Genesis cycle with HB's Biroid booster...and the first Redux deck, Sword of Damocles 2.0 - Dangle Harder!

Previous Dec@Day Decks:

  • 01 HB: EtF - Fix It in Beta
  • 02 An: Noise - Trojan Whale
  • 03 Ji: PE - Sword of Damocles
  • 04 Cr: Gabe - By Hook or By Crook
  • 05 NBN: MN - Watching Out for You
  • 06 Sh: Kate - The Art Thief

name: HB Click Advantage v0.0
description:
Haas-Bioroid has a few themes in it but in my opinion, the biggest is Click Advantage. Clicks, just like credits, are a resource. Whether augmenting theirs with cards like Biotic Labor or Director Haas or taxing the runner's with Bioroid ICE, this is what HB does best. They have two IDs that give a click like advantage: Haas-Bioroid: Engineering the Future (free credit when you instal which is similar to an extra click) and NEXT Design: Guarding the Net (3 Installed ICE and 3 Draws are effectively 6 clicks). I went with the latter. While in the long run, HB:EtF is a bigger payoff, I think getting the effect of 6 clicks right off the bat is a better advantage, specially when you want to build strong servers (I want this since I plan to use Director Haas).

This deck is all concept/theory so any help and critique are most welcomed.

name: Suzie Q
description: The idea behind this deck is that Q's ability makes darwin more powerful. the first barrier she sees she breaks for practically nothing with e3 in play. the second gets smashes for a david counter if above 5 strength and then e3 or morning star for one credit, or none if off of cyberfeeder. Everything else gets destroyed with parasite recursion and wyrm combo or darwin and then E3. continuous pressure and ruthless effeciency. it should cost her 0-2 credits to get into any server early. and at most 5 credits in the late game. Pretty good I would say.

name: David and Goliath (Summer 2014 Tournament Winner)
description:
Hello all! This is the runner deck I piloted to a win at the Summer 2014 Tournament at Atomic Goblin Games in Longmont, Colorado on 9/7/2014.

3 Rounds of tournament play:

Agenda Point Win vs. Cerebral Imaging (Doran's Blade style deck) Agenda Point Win vs. Engineering the Future (NEXT Glacier) Agenda Point Loss vs. Personal Evolution (Typical PE, with Power Shutdown splashed)

Hello all! This is the corp deck I piloted to a win at the Summer 2014 Tournament at Atomic Goblin Games in Longmont, Colorado on 9/7/2014.

3 Rounds of tournament play:

Agenda Point Win vs. Chaos Theory (Recurring Progarms/Events with Account Siphon Splashed) Agenda Point Win vs. Silhouette (Wasn't able to figure out this deck list archetype...game ended quickly) Agenda Point Win vs. Kate (Magnum Opus Kate of doom)
